1.66.text: Hi.  Today I'm at  Florence Court in Northern Ireland.

3.87.text:
I'm going to take a walk down to the walled
garden.  It's early winter, so it will be interesting to

7.65.text: see what's available but I'm sure there'll be some fantastic produce to use.

16.20.text: OK, so I want something sweet for dessert.

18.18.text: I was told that here there used to be a glasshouse which was heated from a boiler round the back.

21.93.text: They would most certainly would have grown oranges and a lot of other citrus fruits as well.

25.94.text: So as a mark of the spirit of the place, to the gardeners that worked so hard to produce that fruit,

30.40.text: I'm going to do a ginger and orange cake.  Really, really good combination. So warming as

34.39.text: well at this time of the year.

36.64.text:
So I'm here in the historic kitchen at
Florence Court.

39.40.text:
I've got self raising flour,  straight into
the bowl.  A little bit of bicarbonate of soda,

43.89.text:
and then in there we've got a mix of
spices.  So we've got some cinnamon, we've

46.91.text: got some ground mixed spice, we've got some ginger.

49.16.text:
Actually there's a lot of ginger.  Really,
really powerful.

52.60.text: You could cut down on it if you wanted.  And just give that a quick mix round.

56.81.text: So I'll just put that to one side and bring in my pan.  I've got some milk.

59.99.text: That goes straight into the pan.  I've got soft brown sugar,

63.01.text: and then we've got golden syrup and black treacle.  The next ingredient I'm going to take is

68.06.text:
We're going to keep the syrup because
we're going to use that later on.

71.14.text: We're just going to take the stem ginger,

72.83.text: and we're going to roughly chop this. And then we're going to add that into the milk as well.

77.50.text: We're now going to take that over to the hob and we're going to warm it through.

80.25.text: We just need to warm it enough to just dissolve the sugar and make sure that

84.93.text: That's starting to warm through nicely.

86.80.text: Now we've got the satsumas. Make sure these are washed,

89.29.text:
slightly warm water just to remove any
wax that might be on them.  Nice thin slices.

94.14.text: I'm now going to layer those in the tin, so if you imagine a pineapple upside

97.32.text: down cake.  It has that kind of idea.

99.24.text: As it bakes, the skin will soften down.  It will soak up the sugars and the syrups,

103.86.text:
so you end up with almost a candied
orange slice.  Absolutely perfect for winter.

108.06.text: What I'm now ready to do is bring the mix over with the milk.

111.71.text: We'll get the butter into there and we'll melt that down.  The smell is just ah,

115.41.text: really, really nice. So we've got some eggs,

118.51.text:
and now we're going to add that into the
flour.

121.00.text: Because we've got bicarbonate of soda in there,

123.41.text:
as soon as that gets in there it's going
to start frothing up so

126.87.text:
you need to be reasonably quick with
mixing it and getting into the trays and

131.04.text: Just nice and gently over the top, nice and level.  Divided between the two trays.

135.56.text:
They are now ready to go straight into the
oven.

144.51.text: OK, so I've got my two cakes.  These have now cooled down.

147.19.text: I need them cold because I'm going to make a frosting now.  In the bowl I've got

150.22.text: a mix of butter and margarine, and we've got the

153.46.text: syrup from the ginger and then we've got icing sugar.  Once the icing sugar's all incorporated,

158.46.text:
and I know that I'm not going to disappear
into a cloud of icing sugar,

161.57.text:
we can start to beat it.  And that's ready to
go onto the cake.

164.60.text: OK, so to turn the cake out, a little piece of greaseproof which I'm just going to put over the top.

169.69.text: Put the board on.  Just turn that over.  Just peel off that paper that we put on to

177.12.text:
Wow, real hit of orange then.  Tip the
frosting on.

180.69.text: So to get the top on, I'm just going to take the greaseproof.

184.92.text: We're going to lift the cake slightly, just fold that underneath.

188.44.text: Lift the whole thing on the tray. Just gently start

192.10.text:
pulling the greaseproof.  Push the cake. 
Slide the board out and let it drop on.

198.00.text: And now that's ready to be sliced, and served with a really nice cup of coffee.
